text:
Footnote duplication occurs when the footnotes are generated from tables. 
When a table does not fit on the current page it is moved to the next one, but 
the footnotes belonging to the table are not cleared from the current page.
The footnotes will appear both on the current as well as on the next page.
creator: artur.lorincz@kiq.com

text:
footnote duplication seems to be fixed in current trunk.

on the other hand: if there is a footnote in a table header an the table header
is repeated on the next page because the table overflows, the footnote body is
only printed on the next page, even though the anchor already appears on the
first page. 

Is this a bug or intented behaviour?
